case_vignette: A 50-year-old female with no pertinent medical history presents with a two year history of dark spots on the face. She noticed the dark spots when applying make up one day. She denies any pruritus, pain, trauma or use of any new topical skin products. The dark spots have increased in number and may have slightly grown in size. She has not tried any treatments. Physical examination reveals brown irregular patchy poorly demarcated macules coalescing into patches on the bilateral zygomatic cheeks with some extension on lateral cheeks.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have dark spots on my face that have increased in number and may have slightly grown in size over the past two years.
Have you noticed any changes in the texture or sensation of these spots, like itching or bleeding?
No, I haven't experienced any itching, pain, or other changes in sensation with these spots.
Have you had any significant sun exposure or tanning habits recently or in the past?
I haven't mentioned any specific details about sun exposure or tanning habits in my history.
Do these dark spots have irregular borders or vary in color within each spot?
Yes, the dark spots have irregular borders and are patchy.
Do you have any family history of skin conditions or cancers?
I haven't mentioned any family history of skin conditions or cancers.
Final Diagnosis: Melasma
